bill.title: Medical Marijuana; Primary Caregivers
bill.description: Increases the maximum number of qualifying patients that a primary caregiver may care for at any given time. Requires each primary caregiver upon registration to disclose to the Department of Health the number of qualifying patients and other patient information for whom the caregiver is responsible. Limits the number of marijuana plants that can be grown for medical marijuana use to 14 plants at a single property. (HB1455 HD1)

history.action: Referred to HLT, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 6
Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT on Saturday, 02-07-15 10:00AM in House conference room 329.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org
The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-11-15 11:30AM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Wednesday, 02-11-15 11:30AM in House conference room 329.

The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 6 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, Creagan, Morikawa, Fukumoto Chang; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Jordan, Kobayashi; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Tupola; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Hashem, Oshiro.
Reported from HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 232) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with Representative(s) Aquino, Cachola, Cullen, Jordan, Matsumoto, McKelvey, Oshiro, Pouha, San Buenaventura, Tokioka, Yamane voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Har, McDermott, Tupola, Ward voting no (4) and Representative(s) Takumi excused (1).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Wednesday, 02-18-15 3:00PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on CPC recommend(s) that the measure be deferred.
